sect1.title: Configuring the system hostname
sect1.para: During the boot process, both systemd and System V use the same file for establishing the system's hostname. This needs to be configured by creating /etc/hostname.

<lfs> needs to be replaced with the name given to the computer. Do not enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) here. That information is put in the /etc/hosts file.
